Alternatively upgrade to a modern browser. For six years, John Harris and John Domokos have travelled the UK to get a sense of British politics away from the Westminster bubble. Meanwhile, old-fashioned two-party politics has crumbled amid a rising sense of discontent with the status quo. For their new series, the pair are back on the road, hunting down radical new politics in some unlikely places Where should we go? document.post: The good thing about Corbyn is that he is a real, genuine voice of the Labour left. It is as important a voice to listen to as the tory right & UKIP are in England and the SNP in Scotland. Labour especially has lost its way in Scotland. May 5th will potentially see Labour come 3rd in Scotland, a result not seen since 1918. Getting to the bottom of that - and why the Tories may beat Labour into 3rd in Scotland is vital to understanding deep-seated rot in the Labour Party. I've recently stopped commenting on \"The Scotsman\" website as there were very sinister efforts to reveal my identity by a small group of Tory comments writers, or possibly just one obsessed person. They seemed to work out who I was either from me clicking a link to their own website, or altogether more sinister means - and they started to tell people the letter that my surname begins with. Either way, I don't want to put my family through some troll/media ordeal (I'm not famous, wealthy or any kind of public figure, just a regular Joe, like you, dear reader, with an opinion). What is happening in Scotland is just beyond bonkers, but worth a look to understand why.
